CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 25, 1943, pg. 8, reads: "Executive Board Compiling Discipline - The Executive Board and Compiling Committee of Triumph The Church and Kingdom of God In Christ appointed by the General Conference recently held in Birmingham, Ala., compiling connectional discipline. Sitting left to right: Bishop D. H. Harris of Pittsburgh, Pa., chairman of the committee and presiding bishop of seven states; Rev. J. W. Williams, Muncie, Ind., presiding prince of Indiana; Mrs. C. A. Price, Pittsburgh, secretary to the bishop and president of the Women's missionary work in Pennsylvania; Miss Bernice Coleman of Pittsburgh, stenographer to the bishop and committee, is president of the Youth Conference.  Standing, left to right: Rev. J. T. Hill of Gadsen, Ala., who served as national chaplain of the National Congress.  He is a prince of the church and pastor in Anniston, Ala.; Rev. R. C. Glanton of Cross City, Fla., and outstanding presiding prince of Florida and North Carolina, and Rev. H. M. Harris of El Dorado.  He is widely known as one of the leading evangelists in denomination. - Photo by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Executive Board and Compiling Committee of Triumph The Church and Kingdom of God In Christ seated from left: Bishop D. H. Harris, Rev. J. W. Williams, C. A. Price, Bernice Coleman; standing: Rev. J. T. Hill, Rev. R. C. Glanton, and Rev. H. M. Harris, gathered around table with typewriter and mimeograph machine
